review.title: “Very good, stable company”
review.pros: Pros – Very good, stable company to work for. Many brands and departments in one location if you are interested in working for a very large company.
review.cons: Cons – Limited advancement given how the company is structured. No management training.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Too many silos, where one department doesn't know what the other is doing and how decisions affect others.

review.title: “Stable, but not exciting in terms of product”
review.pros: Pros – Stable, good hours for the fashion industry.
review.cons: Cons – Not very clear management structure. Run very "family business" style, even though the company has grown quite large
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More standard performance review practices, allow employees to explore and work towards advancement.

review.title: “A learning experience”
review.pros: Pros – Great relationship with coworkers. Learned a lot about all aspects of garment manufacturing.
review.cons: Cons – Not fairly compensated. Under staffed in a lot of areas
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take note in the people who true work hard for the company interest free because they truly love what they do. And reward them accordingly. A lot of employees feelNeglected.

review.title: “i'm really appreciating the seasoned marketing and branding executive & G-III is a leading manufacturer and distributor”
review.pros: Pros – G-III’s business outlook or future economic performance, anticipated revenues, expenses or other financial items; product introductions and plans is completely amazing and takes the best care of its employes .
review.cons: Cons – No one is perfect and it is this imperfection which develops the organization and G-lll's is really showing its talent and crosses its barriers .
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – work with honestly and keep in mind G-lll is our bread and butter .

review.title: “A company which offers the freedom and platform to manage your own business”
review.pros: Pros – The company is flexible, giving key employees who are ambitious the freedom and scope to go out and get things done, with very little red tape. G-III operates like a small business, although there are public group with over $1 billion in annual sales.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of structure and policy often leads to confusion about who is responsible when things do not go as well as planned.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company
